IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: FOR APPROXIMATELY 450 CHILDREN, GESU SCHOOL IS AN INDEPENDENT CATHOLIC SCHOOL (PRE-K TO 8TH GRADE) IN THE JESUIT AND IHM TRADITIONS PROVIDING ACADEMIC, SPIRITUAL AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT TO CHILDREN WHO RESIDE PRIMARILY IN POVERTY STRICKEN AREAS OF PHILADELPHIA.
IRS990.MissionDesc: FOR APPROXIMATELY 450 CHILDREN, GESU SCHOOL IS AN INDEPENDENT CATHOLIC SCHOOL (PRE-K TO 8TH GRADE) IN THE JESUIT AND IHM TRADITIONS PROVIDING ACADEMIC, SPIRITUAL AND SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT TO CHILDREN WHO RESIDE PRIMARILY IN POVERTY STRICKEN AREAS OF PHILADELPHIA.
IRS990.Desc: ELEMENTARY & PRE-K EDUCATION PROVIDED ON A NON-SELECTIVE BASIS FOR 450 INNER-CITY SCHOOL CHILDREN, HOUSED IN A FACILITY DONATED BY ST. JOSEPH'S PREP. THE EDUCATIONAL BENEFITS OF THE GESU SCHOOL ARE EVIDENCED BY HISTORICAL HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION RATES FOR ITS STUDENTS OF 90% VERSUS THE AVERAGE RATE IN PHILADELPHIA OF 70%, AND 80% STATE-WIDE.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: VANGUARD INTERMEDIATE TERM CORP BOND ADM

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN INVESTMENT COMMITTEE WHICH OVERSEES THE INVESTMENT ADVISORS' INVESTMENT OF ENDOWMENT ASSETS TO PROTECT THE FUTURE PURCHASING POWER OF THE PRINCIPAL OF THE ENDOWED FUNDS AND PROVIDE A SOURCE OF INCOME TO SUPPORT THE ACTIVITIES OF THE ORGANIZATION. INVESTMENT RETURNS THROUGH JUNE 30, 2018 HAVE AVERAGED AN ANNUAL RATE OF RETURN OF 7.7% FOR THE LAST FIVE YEARS. THE RETURN OBJECTIVE IS TO PRODUCE AN AVERAGE RATE OF RETURN SUFFICIENT TO PRESERVE THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT AFTER WITHDRAWALS ARE TAKEN. ACTUAL RETURNS IN ANY GIVEN YEAR MAY VARY FROM THIS AMOUNT. THE INVESTMENT COMMITTEE DETERMINES SPENDING OF THE ORGANIZATION'S PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS IN ITS INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO WITHIN THE PARAMETERS OF ACT 141 (BETWEEN 2% TO 7% OF ENDOWMENT VALUE). FOR EACH OF THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THE INVESTMENT COMMITTEE DETERMINED THE SPENDING RATE TO BE 4.25% OF DONOR-RESTRICTED AND BOARD-DESIGNATED ENDOWMENT FUNDS IN ITS INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO, BASED ON THE INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO'S FAIR VALUE DETERMINED QUARTERLY ON THE LAST TRADING DAY OF EACH CALENDAR QUARTER AND AVERAGED OVER THE 12 QUARTERS THROUGH MARCH 31 OF THE PREVIOUS FISCAL YEAR.

THE ORGANIZATION AND ITS AFFILIATE ARE QUALIFIED PUBLIC CHARITIES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND ARE EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES. TAX FILINGS ARE SUBJECT TO AUDIT BY VARIOUS TAXING AUTHORITIES. OPEN PERIODS SUBJECT TO AUDIT ARE GENERALLY THE PREVIOUS THREE YEARS OF TAX RETURNS FILED.
FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES 85,221. COST OF GOODS SOLD 3,841.
FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES 85,221. COST OF GOODS SOLD 3,841.
YES, POLICY IS PUBLICIZED THROUGH THE SCHOOL'S MISSION STATEMENT, WEB-SITE AND VARIOUS OTHER FORMS OF COMMUNICATION.

THE GESU SCHOOL HAS DEFINED ELIGIBILTY REQUIREMENTS AND MAINTAINS ELIGIBILTY RECORDS FOR GRANTS PROVIDED TO THE SCHOOL'S STUDENTS AND GRADUATES OF THE SCHOOL WHO ARE CURRENTLY IN HIGH SCHOOL. IN PROVIDING GRANTS TO STUDENTS OF OTHER SCHOOLS, GESU SCHOOL PROVIDES THEIR GRANT ELIGIBILTY REQUIREMENTS TO THOSE SCHOOLS AND ASKS THOSE SCHOOLS TO DETERMINE ELIGIBLE STUDENTS AND TO MAINTAIN ELEIGIBILTY RECORDS IN ORDER TO PRESERVE PRIVACY AND AVOID THE EXPOSEURE OF ANY PERSONAL STUDENT INFORMATION.

THE GESU SCHOOL RECEIVED FOURTEEN SEPARATE CONTRIBUTIONS OF SECURITIES-PUBLICALLY TRADED STOCKS DURING THE YEAR. THE CONTRIBUTIONS WERE: 265 SHARES OF JP MORGAN LARGE CAPITAL STOCK, 339 SHARES OF JP MORGAN US LARGE CAPITAL STOCK, 10 SHARES OF ALEXION STOCK, 475 SHARES OF VIAVI STOCK, 475 SHARES OF VIAVI STOCK, 215 SHARES OF H-LINE STOCK, 750 SHARES OF ZYNERBA PHARMA STOCK, 38 SHARES OF COSTCO STOCK, 37 SHARES OF DISNEY STOCK, 34 SHARES OF DISNEY STOCK, 150 SHARES OF ORACLE STOCK, 190 SHARES OF VAIL RESORTS STOCK, 70 SHARES OF AG S&P 500 ETF STOCK, AND 172 SHARES OF GLAXOSMITHKLINE STOCK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN ELECTRONIC COPY OF THE 990 IS SENT TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS FOR COMMENT AND REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING THE 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMMITTEE ON TRUSTEES IS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY OF OVERSEEING CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AMONG THE BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS. THE COMMITTEE CONDUCTS ON-BOARDING TRAINING FOR ALL NEW BOARD MEMBERS DURING WHICH THE SCHOOL'S POLICY ON CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS ADDRESSED. DURING FISCAL YEAR 2017 THE COMMITTEE WAS NOT AWARE OF ANY SITUATIONS OR AFFILIATIONS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, SUCH AS DOING BUSINESS WITH CLOSE FAMILY MEMBERS; DIRECTING INVESTMENTS THRU WHICH ONE COULD BENEFIT FINANCIALLY; OR ANY OTHER TYPES OF TRANSACTIONS OR RELATIONSHIPS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT'S SALARY IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE PRESIDENT & EC REVIEW OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES COMPENSATION PLANS. IN EACH CIRCUMSTANCE, RELEVANT COMPARATIVE DATA IS USED TO EVALUATE THE COMPENSATION PACKAGE OFFERED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GESU SCHOOL INC.'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. FINANCIALS STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE AT WWW.GESUSCHOOL.ORG.

IdRelatedOrgTxblPartnershipGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PENNSYLVANIA CREDIT PROGRAMS
